title: Outbound brakes on the inbound... prevent infinite loop
body:
**User Story**  Stop doing that !

**Epic Title**  LDAP Outbound

**T-shirt size**: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | M

**User Story**  "As a user of a Next, I would be majorly depressed if the app went into an infinite loop when a change comes in via LDAP, we should figure out a way to prevent this"

**Description**  If a change occurs in the client it will already have been updated in ReThink -- we need to compare to what we have in the DB and don't process changes if we are already in sync.
 
**Acceptance Criteria/Tests** 
- verify that we don't overwrite the same data in ReThink on AD changes.
- inbound integration test automation that demonstrates this -- show that the updated date doesn't change

title: Bugfix/username uniqueness
body:
**

> Change Log:

**

- Identify the POST API that is being called when **Create New User** (sign up) button is hit. This API will get the new user account creation details including - "username": (**Included all the necessary code logic in POST /api/users API in users.py**)
- Also, identify the query that is called to fetch the count of matching users with same as given username in the Rethink Database. If not exists already create this query: (**Included new query to fetch the username match count in users_query.py**)
- Enforced restriction on new user creation, if the username is **NOT UNIQUE**.
- Introduced the **error-handling** to display - "User already exists" message in UI.
- Wrote a new integration test **"users_api_tests.py"** around this logic.

The role should display the owner and the role members when I navigate to the role page.

When I navigated to the role "r_aem_users_admin" NEXT tries to look for the summary of the owner, svc_adds_unowned. But because svc accounts were not imported into NEXT, NEXT could not find the role owner for r_aem_users_admin. When I visit the page, it continually shows a loading animation for the owner and a loading animation for the chatbot. I have attached screenshots of the bug below.

title: Broad Search results display
body:
User Story | Display a potentially mixed set of results from Broad Search
----------|----------
Epic Title | Search
T-shirt size:  | 
User Story | "As a user of NexT, sometimes I don't know exactly where to look to find something... I would like to be able to enter a search string into a top level search and have Next present me with all possible results for my search."

**Description**  This is the result set for the "search" box in the left hand pane of the app.  This search box is always visible and is context free so we need to show all possible matches (full or partial) to the given query.  Possible types of objects returned are as follows:
- person object -- where full name or email match the query string
- person object -- where person's manager matches the query string  
- role object -- where the role owner, role name or role description matches the query string
- pack object -- where the pack owner, pack name or pack description matches the query string


**Acceptance Criteria/Tests**  
- all possible results for a given query should be displayed in a single page.
- different types of results should be grouped together (with a section title maybe?)
- within each section, the results should be sorted into an obvious order (for example, search for all persons with the first name "Patrick" might sort by last name instead of by employee hire date. )
- performance of search query is a key factor here...  all results shown within XX units.
- each result type should be clickable and the user will be navigated to the logical place if they select one:
     - clicking a person object takes you to the People page, org chart view with that person selected (so their org shows on the right pane)
     - clicking a role or pack type takes you to the details pane for that object.

**Questions**: 
- Can we do this by firing off a group of parallel searches from the UI and consolidating the results or would it be more efficient to have one api that can return all results (tagged and sorted somehow so we know how to display them)
- what is the upper limit on response time for this to be useful?  If the user sees results populating as they are found, they might see the result they wanted before search completes....  could we do that with a backend search API?

title: Auto-accept proposals where requestor is also approver
body:
User Story | Sometimes I like to talk to myself
----------|----------
T-shirt size: | 
User Story | "As a user of NexT I find that sometimes I need to ask myself for permission.  In such cases, Next should just remove a few clicks and go ahead and do my bidding."

**Description**
There are a few scenarios where the requester and the approver are the same.  In those cases, Next should recognize this and automatically accept the proposal without requiring the approver to act.  
- when a role/pack creator adds members at creation time (requires on_behalf_of functionality)
- when role/pack creator asks to become a member of the role/pack that they own.

**Acceptance Criteria/Tests** 
- any scenario that would normally result in the approver being asked to accept/reject their own request should instead be auto-approved.
- since proposal are still being created and processed, the ledger should still show that a proposal was made and it was approved.
- no alerts get generated for such proposals

title: Research -- on_behalf_of functionality
body:
**Research:** Design the 'on_behalf_of' functionality to act on proposals
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge):  M

**Description:**
Design the functionality around being able to act on a proposal on someone's behalf (to support DELEGATION and HIERARCHICAL approval features).  

**Requirements:**
1. actions taken on a proposal are correctly recorded to ledger when delegate/manager acts on them.
2. we don't record proposals that have expired during a delegation -- only those acted upon.
3.  UI will need to be able to reflect this information to user -- When Manager accepts on behalf of Approver, the UI can show this info in both the Manager's history and the Approver's history.
4. only needs to support ONE actor -- one person will be recorded as accepting or rejecting a proposal. However, anyone in the management chain can be the actor.  (see #1215 for hierarchical rules)  


**Acceptance Criteria**
- timeboxed work -- to be delivered in the first third of the sprint.
- Design review completed -- team understands and agrees on the design.
- work with the SM/PO to add the identified stories to the backlog.

Tasks

- [x] Research current state of on_behalf_of

- [x] Design a solution to include on_behalf_of within proposals and how it interacts with our APIs + UI, with PlantUML diagrams

- [x] Present ideas to team and receive feedback

- [x] Finalize solution and create a ticket to implement on_behalf_of

title: LDAP Delta inbound only updating 1000 users
body:
Bug | Delta inbound only updating 1000 users
----------|----------
Expected behavior | All users need to be updated for the delta inbound checks
Actual behavior | 1000 users are updated each time.
Build | Post Sprint 13 build
Severity | 2.  Blocks functionality

Repro steps
```
From backend:
1. log onto the server
2.  Look at the docker logs
3.  The ldap delta is only pulling 1000 users it should be pulling all of them.
From frontend:
1. Log into next.
2. Navigate to people
3. Wait for people to load > You will see a bunch of users with username listed
4.  Type 'Arthur' into the search bar > you will see a user that has display name shown instead of username
```

- [ ] Fix the fetch_ldap_data() in delta_inbound_sync to work more like the one in initial_inbound_sync.
- [ ] Update inbound_delta_sync as necessary to use fixed fetch_ldap_data()
- [ ] Test and validate that delta sync is working as expected.

title: Blockchain response handling
body:
[User Story] | Blockchain response handling
----------|----------
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | M
User Story | "As a developer I want to handle all responses from the blockchain not just the rejected and approved responses."
Description | Currently the responses that are coming off the blockchain are not all handled.  The only responses being handled are REJECTED and APPROVED.  There was a response that stopped all imports in the queue caused by a different status and needs to be handled appropriately. The ticket includes looking up possible responses from blockchain api and handling them appropriately so that there are no stalls in loading.   This same handling will also need to be used in any proposal creation or any server api endpoints that do direct interaction to the blockchain.  (users)

title: Leveraging Windows alerts
body:
User Story | make effective use of the OS's built in alerts
----------|----------
Epic Title | Alerting
T-shirt size:  | 
User Story | "As a user of a Next, I would like to have my alerts behave in a manner consistent with other apps on my machine so that have fewer incoming streams to monitor"

Description
- an alert that fires in NExt should pop-up the "toast" style alerts in Windows.
- clicking on said alert should take me to the correct page of NexT where I can respond to the alert
- such alerts are "trusted" and the NExt login is bypassed.
- alerts will only appear when NEXt is running in the browser -- no background process

Questions:  
- is this even doable?  Can we bypass login or does Next need to be running and logged in for these to happen? Greatly diminishes the value of this work if I need to be logged in since my session times out with inactivity.
- given that we are a browser app, what runs on the client to install such a hook?
- is there a Mac OS equivalent of this? 

Acceptance Criteria/Tests
- alerts that fire in the app will appear in the standard windows alert manner.
- these can be configured via the Windows setting UI to disable if so desired..

- Disabling means that delegates do not have to accept or reject a delegation before it goes into effect. (#1302)


**Acceptance Criteria/Tests**

- all other aspects of delegation remain in effect.

title: Manage Alerts page

User Story | This is the whiz-bang control panel for configuring alerts
----------|----------

title: Delegation alert in browser

title: Delegations in owner's view
body:
User Story | How the role owner sees active delegations
----------|----------
Epic Title | Delegation
T-shirt size:  | 
User Story | "As an APPROVER in NExts with active delegations, I want to see and still act on pending delegations for my roles."
Description | This functionality allows a role owner who has delegated approvals to someone else to see and act upon Pending proposals.

-  Delegates in an active delegation shall show up under the Delegations tab on Approver UI.  Pending Proposal count next to name (A5-1 in XD)
- role owner can still view and act on these pending proposals
- Selecting a delegate from 'Delegations' list opens a page of the pending proposals assigned to them.  This page has the ability to show proposals Sorted by requester, then role -- OR -- sorted by role then by person.  This page also has the functionality to sort across these categories by date requested.  
- Selecting a proposal (or set of proposals) will allow Role Owner to Approve or Reject
- Once a proposal is acted upon, the proposal will no longer show in the 'Delegated' tab and will appear under the appropriate other tab (Approved or Rejected) with an indication of _who_ did the action.  

Acceptance Criteria/Tests
- delegate avatars, names and pending proposal count shows under Delegations tab only when the delegation is Active (ie current date is between start and stop)
- delegate avatar, names and counts shall appear even the pending count is 0
- once acted upon by the role owner, the proposal will NOT show up in the history for the delegate (since they took no action)

title: Delegation rejection message back to requester - email response
body:
User Story | Let them down easy... via email

T-shirt size:  | 
User Story | "As an Approver in NeXt, I want to be able to explain in email why I am declining to accept a delegation request."
Description |  Message back to the delegation requester upon rejection.
A few ways of dealing this this
- Pressing the 'Reject' button in the email triggers the reject action with a canned message back to the requester.
- Pressing the 'Reject' button in the email causes the email to be replied to (is this possible) and Next catches incoming messages, parses them to find the action and records the response.

**Acceptance Criteria/Tests**

- no markup allowed on messages
- message appears in the requester UI within 1 minute of being sent  (near real time)

title: Next_ID implementation
body:
[User Story] | Next_ID implementation 
----------|----------
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | M
User Story | "As a developer I want all UUIDs to have the same format in the app"
Description | Create a next_id in UUID4 format and add it into the blockchain in ledger sync. Once confirmation has been made from the blockchain add an object with the following format to the user_mapping table during the ledger_sync steps.

```
{ next_id: <string -  UUID4 internally generated>,
  provider_id: <string - provider_id>,
  public_key: <string - key created on signing>,
  remote_id: < string - Upstream GUID or UUID>,
  active: <boolean> 
}
```
The main file to be worked in is ledger_sync/inbound/listener > process function

**Acceptance Criteria/Tests**
- Tests to cover next_id
- All next_ids for group objects, or users are in the same format whether they are created in Next or imported from one of our two providers.  
- All ids going to the front end are the next_ids
- Front end still works for search and UUIDs are created.
- All users and roles have a public key that is recorded with it

- [x]  switch uuids to conform on inbound
- [x] fix authorization with new uuids
- [x] fix manager calls with new uuids
- [x] add distinguished names to the user_payloads and into the blockchain
- [ ] Use next_id in the block chain entry
- [ ] add inbound entries into the user_mapping_table on entry
- [ ] switch out the user_id in the users table with next_id
- [ ] local_id for new user creation
- [ ] switch out user_id across the app with next_id
- [ ] correct authorization steps
- [ ] correct manager steps
- [ ] fix all tests
- [ ] manually test entire app
- [ ] write tests for anything malfunctioning silently

title: Alerting - delegation email
body:
User Story | Fire off a basic, text only email
----------|----------
Epic Title | Alerting/Delegation
T-shirt size:  | 
User Story |  "As a user of Next, I want to alert my chosen delegate of their nomination as such via email so that they are prompted to drop what they are doing and quickly respond to my request""
Description | Think iteratively...
- This message shall be text only -- no HTML (that can come later)
- The content of the message shall be pulled from the delegation setup form.  
     - recipient email 
     - start date
     - end date
     - outgoing message (if we have one when we tackle this story -- #1313 )
     - Count of roles?  List of roles?  
- messages shall be added to the queue (story #1308) but should be processed immediately since we don't have user preferences for delayed send yet. 

**Acceptance Criteria/Tests** 
1.  Basic text message with target content is sent to target recipient within 10 min of delegation setup 'Send' button being pressed.
2.  No 'Approve/reject' button on this message yet,  No deep link back into Next either.  The goal here is to pull content from a form, build a message , add it to the queue and process the queue.

```
{ next_id: <string -  UUID4 internally generated>,

```

Question:  While we definitely want alerts aggregated, it's not clear if this happens with enqueuing or at alert (email) generation time.

title: Create requests on behalf of others..
body:
User Story | Ability to create a request on_behalf_of someone
----------|----------
T-shirt size:  | 
User Story | "The NeXt system needs to generate proposals for renewing access that is soon to expire."

**Description**
The user story above is one scenario where this capability is needed.  Others might be "co-worker helps new team member get up and running by generating proposals for them." or "HR/SysAdmin provisions new hire's accounts before they show up for first day of work."  or "I'm creating this new role/pack and I know all of my current team will need access to it so I add them at creation time"  Basically we need proposals that say "UserA is requesting that UserB gets access to roleX."  

**Acceptance Criteria/Tests**
- This story is to enable this type of proposal.  There are several use cases for it and those  UI stories will have dependency on this one.  
- "NExtSystem" should be a valid proposal creator -- for the use case listed above
- any module dealing with proposals needs to handle this type.  

Questions:  
- Does this idea of NextSystem creating proposals break SOX compliance at all?
- How should this show in the UI ?

title: Delegation allows role selection
body:

----------|----------
Epic Title | Delegation
T-shirt size: | 
User Story | "As an APPROVER in nExT, I want to the ability to delegate *part* of my owned roles to another person -- not all of them"
Description | add role search and selection to delegation setup page.

title: Delegations require acceptance
body:
User Story | Delegation acceptance
----------|----------
Epic Title | Delegation
T-shirt size:  | 
User Story | "As an APPROVER in nEXt, I don't want proposals routed to me unless I have reviewed the delegation and acknowledged my acceptance of it."
Description | ...
- see related story #1301 
- initial creation of a delegation shall alert the DELEGATE that an acceptance is needed.
- clicking on the alert shall navigate the user to the DELEGATION summary page
- the delegations requiring acceptance are of status "PENDING" and are highlighted on the page so they stand out.  
- the delegation shall have an buttons for accepting or rejecting the delegation.
- the description of the delegation makes it clear which ones are delegated FROM me and which are delegated TO me (separate sections on the page maybe?)

Acceptance Criteria/Tests
- user is able to see the alert that something is needed
- clicking on the the alert takes them to the right page
- able to ACCEPT or REJECT any delegation request.

Questions:
- should we have a way to message back the requester with a reason for rejection?  If so, where would it show up?  How about in the summary page as "Response"
- Should rejected delegations stick around?  on the requester side it makes sense so they can edit them and resubmit but on the delegate side they are just more clutter

title: Editing Delegations
body:
User Story | Modifying existing delegations
----------|----------
Epic Title | Delegation
T-shirt size:  | 
User Story | "As an APPROVER in the NeXt app, I want to modify an existing delegation"
Description | Clicking on any of the listed Delegations on the summary page...
- takes me to the Delegation setup page.  Current values for this delegation are filled in.
- For _Active delegations_, I can only change the END date
     - moving the date to today means the delegation will end today.
     - I can't move end date into the past
     - moving the date further out extends the duration of the delegation.*
- For _Pending Start_ delegations 
     - I can edit both start and stop dates on a delegation*
     - I can edit the list of roles to add or remove them*
- For _Pending Approval_ delegations
     - can't edit until accepted or rejected?
- for _Ended/Rejected_ delegations
     - I can edit the start and stop dates to resurrect a delegation*
     - One of the UI mockups shows a "suggested combinations of roles" based on past delegations.  Maybe this is a better way of saving common delegation configurations??
     - I can change the list of affected roles or the delegate name -- but nothing Send button is deactivated until I have selected viable dates for the delegation.*

*these scenarios will require an acceptance notification to be sent (related story)
    
**Acceptance Criteria/Tests** 
- demonstrate editing of each type listed above

title: Current Delegations page
body:
User Story | Summary page of current, future and pending delegations
----------|----------
Epic Title | Delegation
T-shirt size:  | 
User Story | "As an APPROVER in the NeXT app, I want to see a summary page of my current and future delegations so I can be reminded of who and when I have delegated."
Description | This is the first page a user sees when they hit "Manage -> Delegations"
- All delegations I have set up are shown on this page.  
- All delegations that others have set up with me as a DELEGATE are also on this page
     - If these delegations are in "Pending Approval" state then the Accept/Reject buttons are available here.  (assuming of course that acceptance is required - see story #1322)
- Summary info for each delegation includes the # of roles affected, the delegate's name and email, the start and end dates for the delegation. Also the current status of the delegation.
- status for delegations are 
     - **Active** (meaning  proposals for affected roles are currently routed to delegate)
     - **Pending Start** (meaning delegation was accepted but we haven't reached the start date yet)
     - **Pending Approval** (meaning delegation request sent but not yet accepted)
     - **Ended** (meaning we have passed the end date and delegation has stopped)
     - **Rejected** (meaning the delegate didn't agree to process proposals)
- Delegations are grouped by status in this order: Active, Pending Approval, Pending Start, Rejected , Eended.  Within each group they are sorted by start date.
- For this story -- Selecting any of the listed delegations does nothing.  (Editing Delegations story is #1301 )

**Acceptance Criteria/Tests**
- Demonstrate that delegations are correctly shown on this page.  
- Each delegation should show on both the ORIGINATOR's and DELEGATE's summary pages.
- Show that it handles a long list of delegations.  
- Show that it handles very long setup messages in a visually pleasing way.

title: Implemented Nginx Reverse Proxy
body:
With this commit, developers can now spin up an instance of NEXT with SSL/TLS
enabled. Instructions to configure SSL/TLS has also been included in this commit.

Modifications to docker-compose.yaml were made because we will be needing
different types of docker-compose.yaml files based on what environment we are
deploying to. To enable SSL/TLS, the developer will need to run:
./bin/start -b --prod

NEXT with SSL/TLS enabled will be available at https://<domain_name>

Signed-off-by: mtn217 <michael.nguyen79@t-mobile.com>

title: Basic Delegation backend
body:
User Story | Backend bits of the Delegation story #1295
----------|----------
Epic Title | Delegation
T-shirt size:  | 
User Story | "As a developer on NexT, I need to implement some proposal functionality so that the UI can do its thing.... "
Description | ...
- proposals shall support 'on_behalf_of' functionality so that we can record that an action was done by a delegate for someone else.
- Even when a delegation is current, the role owner can still decide to act upon a proposal.  In this case, the ledger will show that 'approver took the action' just like it would if no delegation were in place (ie - doesn't show "A acted on behalf of B who was acting on behalf of A"
- delegations begin and end at the specified time and dates.  Since the dates are inclusive it should be from midnight the day before start to midnight of the end date -- in current time zone.  (unless #1295 says we will let the owner pick date, time and time zone)
- proposals in the role owner's pending queue at the start of the delegation will be moved to delegate's pending queue.
- likewise, roles in the delegate's queue at the end of the delegation shall be moved back to the owner's queue.
- we need to record on the ledger what authority is used to allow this person to act on the proposal.  Was it through hierarchical?  through delegation?  

Acceptance Criteria/Tests | bulleted list
------------|--------------
- verify that pending proposals correctly migrate between queues at start/stop of delegation w/o losing anything or resetting any expiration countdown.

title: Proposal Expiration in the UI
body:
User Story | Proposal expiration in the UI
----------|----------
User Story Title | depends upon #1296
T-shirt size:  | 
User Story |  "As a user of NexT, I know that proposals have a shelf-life and I need to act on them or they will expire.  I know I will get alerted when proposals start to grow stale"
Description | Places where proposal expiration comes into play:

- If approver ignores a proposal beyond the 'alert date' they will get an indication on the bell icon that something needs their attention.  Clicking on it shall tell them what the need is and routes them to the appropriate page in the UI to take action.
- proposals about to expire will be counted and included in the snapshot page (and in snapshot email)
- proposals that *have* expired shall be listed in the 'Expired' tab on the Approver UI.
- proposals that have expired during a delegation for that role will show as "expired by Delegate on behalf of Approver"
- expiring proposals are considered 'Warnings' on the alerts preferences page -- disabling warnings will hide these notifications.

Acceptance Criteria/Tests | Demonstrate that expiring proposals will show/be counted in the items listed above.

title: Proposal Expiration
body:
User Story | Proposals expire if not acted upon
----------|----------
T-shirt size: | 
User Story | "Proposals in Next have a defined time to live and will expire if not acted upon"
Description | see bulleted list of items: 
- All proposals have a lifespan.
- TTL on proposals is application wide and it set in the same place that all app-wide settings are stored. (for V1 this is .env file for docker?)
- There is also an alert time for proposals -- how far in advance to trigger alerts that proposals are expiring to to escalate up the chain of command.  (even though escalation is V2, I think the concept of 'soon to expire proposals' is V1)
- expire date and alert date are written into proposals when they are created -- therefore do not update if the TTL, alert window are changed before they expire.
 
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | stuff to show me
------------|-----------
- Verify that proposals contain expiration date and alert date

title: Basic Delegation functionality
body:
User Story |  First cut at being able to delegate proposals to others
----------|----------
Epic Title | Delegation
T-shirt size:  | 
User Story | "As a user of NeXt, I would like all of my proposals to be handled by someone for a certain time period so that proposals continue to flow."
Description | This is the first thin vertical slice of functionality on delegation -- not intended to be the full blown feature.  

- Manage -> Delegations page turned on.  Doesn't show current, future or pending delegations yet.  Only functional bit is the "create a new delegation" button.
- pressing button takes user to next page to set up a new delegation. 
- "Roles selection" is greyed out -- all owned roles will be delegated for now.
- "Delegate selection" is done by entering email address of delegate for now.
- "From/To" are both required fields and can be done by calendar picker or direct entry.
- For now, delegation doesn't require acceptance on the part of delegate
- any proposal not acted upon by Delegate before it expires will show on the 'Expired' tab but will not show who let it expire. (requires #1296)
- To avoid confusion the approver shall choose date, time and time zone of delegation start and stop.


Acceptance Criteria/Tests | A bullet list of things to verify
----------|----------
- validate correct date entry (if not done by calendar picker)  Stop is later than start.  Haven't picked "Feb 32, 2019"  Haven't picked dates in the past.
- show that delegation begins and ends on the targeted dates.  Dates selected are inclusive.
- verify that delegate can act upon the proposals -- Accept/Reject/Expire
- proposals are correctly written to the ledger with the correct 'on_behalf_of' data
- verify that proposals acted upon correctly show in the history tabs (both owner and delegate)

V1 allows hierarchical approval of **proposals** but not things like editing roles/packs to change ownership or setting up/ extending/ending delegations. Perhaps the V2 feature of having a SysAdmin would take care of this issue.

title: Bypassing reauth issue -- problem?
body:
User Story | Bypassing the manager on reauth
----------|----------
T-shirt size:  | 
User Story | ...  This page intentionally left blank ...
Description |  NeXt has a built in policy that requests to extend access to a role shall require BOTH the role owner and the requester's manager to approve.  However, if the access expires, the requester can simply request access again it is treated like a new request (requiring only the role owner's approval)  How to deal with this...?  
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | 

related to #1230 

It seems that we have a very narrow path to get into this situation -- only when the Manager is not paying attention to pending proposals and it expires then his/her wishes are not considered with the subsequent request (to get access again)  

If the manager *is* paying attention and deals with the proposal before it expires we are fine.

This manager should be able to see this proposal in the list of expired proposals (in the Approver UI) so we have done everything we can to alert them and document what happened....

Do we want to try to build some logic into Next to catch this situation and prevent it?

title: Multi-Party approval UI
body:
User Story |  Multi-party approval in the UI
----------|----------
Epic Title | Multi-party
User Story | As a user of NexT, I need to see unambiguous status of my re-auth proposals so I know that my access will be staying or going."
Description | This builds on the current table in the Pending requests page.  See bullets below:

- [x] For Multi-Party approvals we should have one row for each approver (2 possible in V1 of Next) 
- [x] Each row should have the same request ID (since it is a single request with multiple approvers) 
- [x] Both rows should show the same date.  
- [ ] We should add a column to this table that lists the status for each approver (Pending, Approved, Rejected)
- [ ] reauth requests will show on the user's tab even though the systems has generated them -- they are 'on_behalf_of' the current user'
- [ ] If one approver rejects, it shouldn't immediately close the proposal - it stays on this list until it expires or it gets two approvals (we are considering supporting the concept of changing one's mind on a proposal #1229)

Acceptance Criteria/Tests | Demo the 'my requests' page to reflect the multipart approvals.  Show that one approver approving/rejecting doesn't close the proposal.  A pack will likely generate several reauth requests when it ages...  demo the UI for 15 or so such proposals coming in at once.

title: Removing connections and adding connections.
body: Signed-off-by: Nadia Bahrami <nadia.bahrami@dev9.com>

title: Access expiration logic
body:
User Story | Story to capture how expiring access should operate
----------|----------
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | 
User Story | "As a user of a NexT, I would like the expiration of access rules to apply in a logical, easy to understand manner so I know what to expect."
Description | Capturing a discussion with our architect...  
- Expire date is field in the role-members table -- derived from access duration and grant date. 
- the access duration setting and alert-lead time shall be application wide config settings (not per role)  (see #70)
- if the access duration time is shortened, existing roles are impacted immediately.  This will trigger reauth proposals.   Some roles  will likely  expire immediately and access will go away until the reauth is processed.
- any role that was expired under the previous access duration, shall stay expired even if the duration gets extended and would have extended their access.
- expiration of access is calculated from the approval date for the original proposal (or reauth approval).

title: "Changed my mind" functionality on proposals
body:
User Story | Support the ability for approvers to have second thoughts
----------|----------
T-shirt size: SML | 
User Story | "As an Approver in NeXt, I should have the prerogative to change the decision on any proposal.  On the Approved/Expired/Rejected screens, I should be able to change the decision on any proposal."
Description | Scenario is that I didn't get to a proposal before it expired, I should be able to go to the Expired proposals page and search for the desired proposal and change the action on it (Probably to Approve it since there wouldn't be any change by rejecting an expired one) Similarly, I should be able to reverse an approval or a rejection.  I *think* this gives us multiple ways to remove a user from a role since we also have this ability in the roles detail page. 
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | Verify that I can change an Expired to Approved.  Change a rejected to an approved, change an approved to a rejected (shouldn't be able to change from Approved/Rejected to Expired)

title: Roles/Table/People toggle on Approved/Expired/Rejected/Pending pages
body:
User Story | consistent views across all approver pages
----------|----------
T-shirt size: | 
User Story | "As an Approver in the NExt app, I would like to be able to see the historical/pending data in various ways.  The app should allow me to pick between sorting by roles, sorting by people or a simple, sortable table on all pages."
Description |  The XD doc shows different ways of displaying data on different pages... instead of deciding for the user, we should make all the options available and let them choose. 
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | Verify that all pages in the title have the three radio buttons and sort the data the correct ways.  Verify that the table results are sortable by the various columns.

title: Request ID into history and searchable
body:
User Story | Request ID shows in history of proposals and is searchable
----------|----------
T-shirt size: SML | 
User Story | "As an approver of role access, I would like to see a unique identifier on all proposals so that I can search and find the exact proposal I need in the case where someone needs to track down details on it."
Description | We show a proposal ID in the 'your requests' table... let's make it useful by adding it to the Approved/Expired/Rejected pages on the Approver UI. Add another column.  Since each of these pages has a search bar, we should be able to search by this value and find the desired proposal.  This should be included in the broad search so that I won't have to do multiple searches if I don't recall the dispensation of a particular proposal.
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | Verify that reqID shows in the desired tables, Demonstrate search capabilities

Try very long names and see how it wraps, Multiple owners per role is a V2 feature so we should make sure we can accommodate.  Member count should be correct (not include owner)  The Bot should differentiate between owner and member (or "have access to this resource? Indded you do"  <-- needs to go away )

title: Record "on behalf of" to ledger sync
body:
User Story | Record the correct data for delegated and hierarchical approval to ledger
----------|----------
Epic Title | #32
T-shirt size: SML | 
User Story | "As an auditor of Next data, I want to see correct records any time someone takes an action on another's behalf so I can ensure compliance is being upheld"
Description | Make sure we correctly record and surface any action taken on behalf of another.  Either through delegation or hierarchical approval.  This may necessitate new proposal types, new data on proposals etc...   The UI should be able to also query and get data for who did what action on whose behalf for display in various places.
Acceptance Criteria/Tests |  verify that both scenarios are supported, view the ledger content to verify that correct records are created.  verify in the UI (in approved/rejected history) that we correctly show 'manager on behalf of owner'

Tasks to do for this story:

- [ ]  Add the 'on_behalf_of' field to the POST for approvals. (was #852)
- [ ]  create unit tests to validate, automated integration tests

title: Research how to View/Act on Pending Proposals for others
body:
User Story | See and act upon pending proposals for people in your org.
----------|----------
Epic Title | #32
T-shirt size: SML | 
User Story | As a manager, I want to be able to see the pending proposals for anyone in my org and act on the proposals on behalf of people in my org.  This keeps approvals flowing even when the regular approver is OOF or otherwise busy"
Description | I'm pretty sure this is implemented today but the enforcement of the org hierarchy is in the UI layer.  We need to move this to the backend. 

Acceptance Criteria/Tests | 
Design review "on paper" and added to the wiki -- 
As a people manager, I should be able to view the pending proposals for people below me in the org chart.  I should not be able to see pending proposals for people outside of my org.  I should be able to approve or reject these proposals on behalf of people in my org.

- [x] Research current state of proposals and hierarchy approval if possible
- [x] Design hierarchy approval and prepare presentation on proposed design 
- [ ] Present findings and create tickets needed to complete hierarchy approval
- [x] Upload PlantUML and presentation to team documentation folder

title: Hierarchical Approval V2
body:
Epic | Hierarchical approval V2 -- the enhancements
----------|----------
T-shirt size default is Extra Large | XL
Description | This epic is to track the V2 functionality for Hierarchical approval.  Mostly we are trying to add escalation and alerting.
Business Need (the why): | Technology allowing approvals to automatically advance up the organizational chart as expiration date approaches (escalation)
Stakeholders |
Details | All the details needed to accomplish the story.
Questions |  1) do we log escalations to the ledger?  2) do proposals continue to escalate all the way up the org until someone takes a stand? -- if so, nothing will ever expire.  Should there be a configurable number of levels to escalate?

Acceptance Criteria
- After a pre-defined time (configurable) has been reached on a proposal, system shall automatically escalate approval request to the approver's next level up manager.
- escalation resets the proposal expiration time so the manager has the same amount of time to process before proposal goes stale again.
- proposals will continue to escalate up the org until someone takes an explicit action (approve/reject)
- each escalation shall trigger an email to the manager who now should take an action.
- each escalation shall cause an alert icon & alert task in Next for the manager
- each escalation shall trigger an email to the requester informing them of the new approver they should be pestering.
- role owner can review any approval done on their behalf and revoke them if they deem necessary.
- role owner can review any approval done on their behalf and confirm them, such a confirmation should be visible in the UI (think checkmark on approved list maybe) and written to the ledger

Description | As much as I dislike creating stories that basically say, "Remember to test stuff" I think we should be explicit about what we are supporting and not supporting.

We should verify functionality on the following as well:  Microsoft Edge, Safari, IE(?)  (when we get here document what version numbers we verified)

title: Roles only from one ID provider
body:
User Story | Roles should be restricted from including members from a different IDp
----------|----------
Epic |  none yet
T-shirt size: SML | 
User Story |  Since our service writes role membership back to an Identity Provider and other services pick up this info from that IDp, we really can't let roles from one service include members from another IDp service.  Don't cross the streams!
Description | 
Acceptance Criteria/Tests |  Users who exist in only identity backend should be prevented from being added to roles that exist only in another. <flesh out these AC once we have a better understanding of how this will work>
Questions | Not sure where in the app we would enforce this...  Do we limit the search results so that users who exist only in one IDp don't see any roles from another?  Do we allow proposal to be generated but auto-reject any requests that would cross IDps?  Need to sync with PO to get some details.

title: Search - People screen
body:
User Story | Search - People screen 
----------|----------
User Story Title | Search - People screen
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | M
User Story | As a user, I want the ability to search all the people within the organization on the People screen.
Description | The screen should dynamically filter people against the input typed into the search box.
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | People screen filters resources in a reasonable manner.

title: Search - Browse screen
body:
User Story | Search - Browse screen 
----------|----------
User Story Title | Search - Browse screen
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | M
User Story | As a user, I want the ability to search all roles and packs on the Browse screen.
Description | The screen should dynamically filter roles and packs against the input typed into the search box.
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | Browse screen filters resources in a reasonable manner.

title: Search roles
body:
User Story | Search roles
----------|----------
Epic Title | #1111 Search
T-shirt size: SML | 
User Story | As a Next, I should be able to search for roles, and get back the roles  that match search criteria.  We will search role name and role description
Description | Fully implement search for roles, connect to the search manager layer.  Depends on Story #1174
Acceptance criteria | able to issue a search request and get back a correct search response for roles.  Used in the Browse page, in building a pack and in delegation pages.

title: Search Packs
body:
User Story  | Search for packs
----------|----------
Epic | #1111 Search
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | 
User Story |  As a user of NExt,  I should be able to search for packs, and get back the packs that match search criteria.  We will search Pack name and Pack Description.
Description | fully implement search for packs, connect the search manager layer.  Depends on Story #1174
Acceptance criteria | User is able to issue a search request and get back a correct search response for packs.  Used on Browse page

title: Search for people
body:
User Story | Search for people
----------|----------
Epic Title | #1111
T-shirt size: SML | 
User Story | As a Next User,  I should be able to search for users to add to my roles, add to my packs or just to see where the live in the org chart. I should get back the all of the users that match search criteria.
Description | fully implement search for users, connect to the search manager layer.  Depends on Story #1174
Acceptance criteria | able to issue a search request and get back a correct search response for users.  No boolean operaters needed.

title: Add users/<user_id>/summary
body: Signed-off-by: George Vanica <gvanica@gmail.com>

title: Build/Prop on a schedule
body:
User Story | Regular builds propped to TEST
----------|----------
T-shirt size: SML | S
User Story | We should be able to have the latest build of NEXt available on the TEST env every day so that we can see changes as they roll in and provide early feedback
Description | I think a cron job was mentioned in the discussion...
Acceptance Criteria/Tests |  TEST env has a stable build.  Tests passed.  Test data is available tool.  Push happens during low activity time of the day but should happen at same time every day.  We should make it clear to everyone how to tell if the daily drop succeeded (do I check travis?  see a version on the UI?  build log?).

title: Next Server Integration Tests
body:
Epic | Next Server Integration Tests
----------|----------
T-shirt size default is Extra Large | XL
Description | Testing needs to occur to ensure the code that is released is functioning as expected without bugs.   There are a lot of modules that have not been tested.  This is to focus on those modules in the server or API section of the app.  Each Module will have it's own ticket.
Business Need (the why): | So bugs can be found prior to being discovered by clients.
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | All tickets have been closed and a suite of tests have been created to address the lack of coverage.

title: [User Story] Use connection pool in rbac-providers
body:
[User Story] | Use connection pool in rbac-providers
----------|----------
Epic Title | #1116 
User Story Title | Use connection pool in rbac-providers
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | M
User Story | Not using a connection pool causes instability in rbac-provider services.
Description | Use the global connection pool module from #1124 to get, reconnect, close, and release rethinkDB connection objects within rbac-provider module functions. 
Business Need | Opening and closing multiple connections without the use of a connection pool risks leaving open connections hanging or having too many connections open at once. 
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | Data flow will remain unchanged and all existent unit/integration tests should pass. The connection pool is used by all functions in `rbac/provider/*` modules to connect to rethinkDB
Depends On | #1124

title: [Task] Create global connection pool module.
body:
Task | Create global connection pool module.
----------|----------
Task Title | Create global connection pool module.
Description | Create a global connection pool module to use by microservices that connect to rethinkDB. This is not implementation, only the creation of the module to be used by microservices being affected by #1116. see: [here](https://github.com/lucidfrontier45/RethinkPool) and [here](https://github.com/njouanin/repool).
Business Need (the why): | We should be using a global connection pool to ensure that we never have too many concurrent connection open at once.

title: Reauth requests automatically triggered
body:
User Story | Reduce the friction!  Automatic reauth when expiration is pending!
----------|----------
Epic Title | #76 
T-shirt size:  | 

**User Story:**  "As a user of a NExT, I don't want to need to monitor the pending expirations of my role access.  Reauth requests should happen automatically at a certain lead time before expiration.  This way I am focused on building killer features instead of looking at NEXT"

**Description**
 The idea of reducing the friction applies here...  we should strive to make things as smooth as possible for users.  Therefore, we automatically request a reauth of permissions.

**Acceptance Criteria/Tests**
- Demo that reauth proposals are generated when the user's access is due to expire minus the lead time. - I would suggest that the lead time we use is the same as proposal expire time.  
- The type of proposal to be generated is the one from #1304.  This work is related to that story but is not exactly blocked by it.

**Question** 
- currently we support a 'renew' button for users who see their access is expiring.  Doing both might generate duplicate proposals?

title: Inbound sync from AD doesn't handle removals
body:
Bug | Inbound doesn't work for removed items
----------|----------
Expected behavior | If a user is removed from a role in AD, we should reflect this in Rethink and ledger 
Actual behavior | inbound sync seems to drop these...
Repro steps | Add a user to a role in AD (via direct AD -- not Next)...  wait for NExt to pick up this change and reflect it in the UI.  Now remove that user from that role via direct AD.  Wait for Next to pick it up... keep waiting.  
Build | no idea... see #822
Severity | 2. blocks functionality
Details/Notes | lets be sure we have automated tests on inbound sync to demo this.

- [ ] Create/update plantuml data-flow diagrams for inbound delta sync.
- [ ] Submit plantuml diagrams for documentation
- [x] Setup small test LDAP instance to generate payloads for group member removal.
- [x] Collect debug logs to confirm/update data-flow for inbound delta sync group member removals.
- [x] Determine viable bug fix.
- [x] Implement bug fix.
- [x] Determine integration testing method to confirm the fix and prevent recurrence of the bug.
- [x] Implement and commit tests.

title: Abstract DB connection usage into a connection pool
body:
Epic | Abstract DB connection usage into a connection pool
----------|----------
Epic Title | Abstract DB connection usage into a connection pool
T-shirt size default is Extra Large | XL
Description | The approach used to query RethinkDB by NEXT microservices must be standardized and consistent. 
Business Need (the why): | The inconsistencies have been causing side effects and instability.
Details | Some microservices use REPL which is not recommended for prod in rethink docs. Some microservices also pass a global connection object around which risks unexpected closure by rethink. we need to ensure that any microservices that query rethink are using a standardized process or connection pool to prevent connections from expiring or having too many connections opened at once. see: [here](https://github.com/lucidfrontier45/RethinkPool) and [here](https://github.com/njouanin/repool).
User Scenarios | TBD
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | All current unit and integration tests should still pass. Data flow should be unchanged.

title: Logical display of Packs & Roles
body:
User Story | We should strive to make it very clear what packs and roles I am a member of...
----------|----------
T-shirt size: | 
User Story | "As a user of nExT, I want to be able to see all roles and all pack in the left pane of the UI so I can quickly and reliably see my current state."
Description | This is a change of how we display a user's memberships.  We currently have one heading called "your roles/packs"   Lets make these into two separate lists -- "your roles" and "your packs"   Roles get added to the list when an owner approves membership.  Packs get added to the list once all roles in the pack have been approved.  The two lists *will* show duplicate information because the pack I have does contain all of the roles I have.  "your requests" will continue to show any items with a Pending status -- once all role requests in a pack are approved, the pack will move from 'your requests" to "your packs"
Acceptance Criteria/Tests |  the roles and pack names will show under the headings as described above.

title: Search
body:
User Story | We have too many roles/packs/people -- help me find what I want
----------|----------
T-shirt size:  |  L
User Story | "As a user of NeXt browsing all available people & roles/packs is overwhelming, we should limit the results via search so I can find what I want."
Description | enter a keyword to search by and I will see results where this term is in searched fields (below).
Acceptance Criteria/Tests |  Results should display as I type them...  the page will refresh and narrow down results in (near) real time.  It's OK if my search term is contained in a field that is not immediately visible in the results (ie if tiles dont show description, I still want to see that tile in the result set)   This first attempt at search will NOT include AND, OR NOT in the search functionality.  The main variations on Search are detailed below.


Requirements:
*Needs to be done, tested and available on the DEMO endpoint by morning of 2/14/19*
 
Backend REST API -- immediately set up to return mock data (or did we land on coding to an API??), will return actual data by 2/13
 
Real time results vs search button 
-- if we do 'search as you type' we need to also pass in the sort order we would like the results to be in  sorting on the backend is preferred to sorting in the UI.  Results should be limited the result type (ie "browse" page search is limited to roles/packs as results)
 
Three main areas to enable search:
1.	Browse screen
a.	Search role/pack names - returns any role containing this string
b.	Search owner name
c.	Search owner email
d.	Search description text
2.	People screen 
a.	Search name
b.	Email,
c.	Job Title (Job title not returned by API yet -- later sprint)
d.	Manager name
e.	Manager email
3.	Broad search 
a.	Broad search (left hand pane) -- needs a new page for displaying results broken out by type of result.
i.	Roles/Packs -- title and description and owner email, owner name
ii.	People -- name and email and manager
iii.	People -- where we matched the person's manager -- implies we search the manager name in the org
 
The idea here is that this page would display any result type divided up by result type.  Ie enter "chrisspanto" and you see all packs and roles owned by Chris, the person object that *is* Chris and all the person objects that are Chris's direct reports.  All displayed in beautiful UI making it easy to find what I want.

title: [Draft] Next credential collision with AD credentials
body:
User Story | Log in with local creds that match AD creds and you get extra powers!
----------|----------
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) |

While removing the UI switch to allow me to pick NEXT/AD will hide this issue, we really should be more robust about rejecting this on login.

title: [Task] Stop Re-using DB Connections
body:
Task | Stop Re-using DB Connections
-------------|------------
Bug | #1094
Description | Files in /rbac/server/api/* need to be rewritten to create and close a new connection object with rethinkDB per query/action instead of reusing the persistent connection object from the global namespace (`app.config.DB_CONN`). Or use the `reconnect` method of the connection object at the start of each action and continue to use the persistent connection from the global namespace [details](https://rethinkdb.com/api/python/reconnect/).  
Business Need (the why): | The persistent connection being passed into the global namespace is closed by rethinkDB after a period of time. This essentially breaks the app.
Applications or Systems impacted | rbac-server

title: Role creator isn't necessarily a role member
body:
User Story | Don't automatically make creators into members
----------|----------
T-shirt size: | 
User Story | Currently if I create a role, it makes me the first member of that group.  We think that Next should never add someone to a role unless they specifically ask to be added.  
Description |  This does bring up a few issues we need to discuss/decide.  We still show the owner on the role detail page (#1226)   If I do want to be a member of the role I just created, then I need to ask for permission and it should be automatically approved (and recorded in the ledger that I joined)
Criteria/Tests | Demo the creation of a role, show it has zero members.  View role details and show that there still is an owner named.  Join the role and view membership.  Show that it recorded in the ledger.

title: [Bug] DB Connection Timeout
body:
Bug | DB Connection Timeout
----------|----------
Expected behavior | Connections to rethinkDB should be created and closed once for each query and not persist within the application.
Actual behavior | A single persistent connection object is created and saved in the global namespace. After prolonged periods the connection is closed by rethinkDB, but rbac-server attempts to reuse the initial connection object from the global namespace. This leads to refused connections from rethinkDB which bubble up through the REST API as connectivity errors in the UI. 
Repro steps | Leave an instance of NEXT running for >1 day and try to log in or use postman to hit any of the REST endpoints that make calls to rethinkDB.
Severity | 2. blocks functionality

title: Logout on refresh
body:
Bug | refreshing the page in the browser takes me to login screen.
----------|----------
Expected behavior | refreshing the page should refresh the page -- ideally show new content.
Actual behavior | logs me out and takes me back to login screen.
Repro steps | from anywhere within the app press refresh button on the browser.
Build | How do I see the version number again?

title: Remove the "NEXT or AD" login radio button
body:
User Story | Credential selection via config file, not at login
----------|----------
T-shirt size: SML | 
User Story | As a SysAdmin of NexT, I get to decide for all the users which credentials they shall use to log into the app (NEXT vs LDAP) thus allowing admins to control access better"
Description | This is essentially an UNDO of #1029 but we are storing the setting in a config file (.env file) per #1088.  This story is related to  #1088 but I think it can be done independently of that one.  Since you can't really create a new AD record from Next we should also hide the "Create an Account" button in the upper right corner.
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | This UI is gone but we can demonstrate that a SysAdmin can switch the setting and users can log in with the selected credentials.  Validate that "Create new account" functionality is also gone.

Questions:  
Do we want some hint to the users like "sign in with your NEXT acct" or "sign in with your corp credentials"?  It's doubtful that this setting would change over time for a given instance so maybe not...

Need to make sure we continue testing in local mode too...  make sure we haven't broken anything.

We probably need to do some planning around this...  security issues concerning escalation of access, etc. Make an epic around this.

title: [UI Design] App config settings page
body:
User Story | We need a page where a SysAdmin can configure the global app settings
----------|----------
T-shirt size: | 
User Story | "As a SysAdmin of the NExt app, I want to see a UI page that only SysAdmins can get to that allow me to set the app config settings."
Description | related to #70 
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | The page should only be accessible to the System Administrator account.  Page should have a consistent look and feel along with the rest of the app.  When user presses 'Save' the settings should take effect without the need to restart the app.  The data entered here shall be preserved across deployments and should be backed up for disaster recovery.

Data includes but is not limited to:

- whether to require LDAP credentials for login or allow stand-alone NEXT app creds
- which LDAP server(s) we are connecting to
- email servers & settings we are using
- blockchain servers to connect to?  settings?
- TTL for proposals
- global default time for role access expiration (in future this may be a 'per role' setting)
- lead time for alerting on role expiration
- global setting for whether or not to allow delegation (#64)
- global setting for whether or not to allow escalation (hierarchical) (#64)
- how many levels to allow escalation
- rules for multi-party approval (all owners, just one owner, at least half of owners)
- The alert-lead time on access expiration should be less than the access duration time 

Of course, the above list is just a starting point for discussion with PO and team.  What other settings are buried in the code?

title: [Bug] Browse role/pack page displaying the same role/pack twice prior to page refresh
body:
Bug | Browse role/pack page displaying the same role/pack twice prior to page refresh
----------|----------
Expected behavior | When navigating to the Browse page, roles/packs should only show up once with the current number of members in that role.
Actual behavior | When I navigated to the Browse page after approving two group access requests, I saw my role displaying twice. The first tile showed that there was only one member, the second showed all 3 members. 
Repro steps | 1) As your user, create a new role. 2) Have two other users request access to this new role. 3) As your user, approve both access requests. 3) Navigate over to the Browse page and you will see two instances of your role being displayed. 4) Refresh the Browse page and you will see only one instance of your role with the correct # of group members.
Build | This was seen during testing of PR #1069.
Severity | 4. Nit or minor UI issue_
Details/Notes | This bug was seen after I made a batch approval of two users to my role.

title: Ledger Sync to Outbound Queue
body:
[User Story] | Investigate LDAP Outbound Sync
----------|----------
User Story Title | Investigate and fix LDAP Outbound Sync
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | M
User Story | 
Description | Currently, changes that are being made to LDAP groups/users on NEXT are not being applied to LDAP provider even though the inbound LDAP ingestion has been working. Figure out the current state of the LDAP outbound sync and properly implement the outbound LDAP sync to allow changes on NEXT be applied to the LDAP provider.
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | 1) Write up for current state of LDAP outbound sync answering "Why is LDAP Outbound Sync not working?" 2) UML diagrams for present state and desired future state.  3) demo that changes made in Next are correctly written back to AD (all CRUD cases)

title: [BLOCKED] Add members to role/pack at creation time
body:
User Story | Add members at role/pack creation time
----------|----------
T-shirt size:  |  M
User Story | "As a role/pack creator, I probably have a few people in mind when creating a new role/pack.  I should be allowed to search for them by name and add them at creation time.  This would save me from having to notify them of the role/pack existance and then they request membership and I then must approve.  Removing steps speeds process and saves money."
Description | This is A16 on the V5 version of the XD UI mockups. 
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | Demonstrate that we have an additional step now in role/pack creation where I can add members directly.  Demonstrate that this is optional.  Show that search functionality allows me to easily find a person by name, username, email. [search not available until #847 is working?]
Questions | Should this trigger a notification to the user who just got added to a role without asking?  Would we be able to send one notification summarizing all the roles in the case of a pack?  If I can't remember a person's name but I know their manager, can I switch from this page to the people page to look them up w/o losing my work?

title: Org chart on People screen
body:
User Story | Add org chart slice to people page
----------|----------
T-shirt size: SML | 
User Story | Context is key when researching people and deciding whether to approve a proposal or not.  We should surface a bit of the org around someone we have selected on the People page so that approvers save some time and can see a persons org at a glance"
Description | This does not replace the full organization chart -- this is in addition to it.  We should only show the selected person and their immediate management chain (no direct reports, no peers)  This information will live in the same space as the current "list of roles this person has" so both will use expandomatic UI technology to show/hide (perhaps it toggles between to the two)  The number of levels of mgmt to display should be sized to the available space.  
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | verify that we can display this content for a wide selection of people in the org.  Verify that we can still view role membership if so desired.  Find someone deep in the org and verify that we truncate correctly...  find someone high in the org and demonstrate that we can see all the way to the top.

title: [User Story] Investigate and fix LDAP Inbound Ingestion
body:
[User Story] | Investigate and fix LDAP Inbound Ingestion
----------|----------
User Story Title | Investigate and fix LDAP Inbound Ingestion
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | M
Story Points | 8
User Story | [Value Statement] "As a user of a certain type (specify), I want to do something (action) so I can provide business value"
Description | On the demo instance, part of the LDAP inbound data ingestion is failing. Users and groups are successfully being imported from LDAP to Rethink's inbound_queue table on the LDAP initial sync and delta sync. The ingestion flow appears to break when records from inbound_queue are sent to Sawtooth blockchain. Currently, when the records are sent to Sawtooth blockchain, they don't get processed and are placed into Rethink's inbound_queue_errors table. We need to find out why the the inbound_queue records are not being processed.
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | 1) Document findings on what caused LDAP Inbound Ingestion to fail 2) Implement the necessary fixes to get LDAP initial inbound and delta inbound sync working 3) Write any missing tests to ensure LDAP inbound ingestion does not fail again.

title: Remove the metadata fields in rethink objects
body:
User Story | Remove metadata fields in rethink objects
----------|----------
T-shirt size: | S
User Story | "As a developer I do not want excess fields created by us to be maintained.  

**Description**  Right now we keep a metadata field on all objects.  With the metadata table we do not need this extra field.  It should be removed.  This process occurs in ledger_sync/inbound/listener  in the metadata creation step.  For an example of hat currently happens look at the groups and users table in rethinkdb and find the metadata field is empty.

**Acceptance Criteria/Tests** Remove the metadata field and have tests to back up the fact that it is not created.

title: Reverse the order of ledger sync processing
body:
[User Story] [Epic] | Reverse the order of Ledger Sync Processing.
----------|----------
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | M
User Story | "As a user I want ingestion to be fast."
Description | Initial/delta inbound sync -- Currently the ingestion cycle is the Block chain ingestion happens prior to the rethinkdb ingestion.  This slows it as the blockchain portion is the longer part of the two.  WE need to reverse the processing to do rethink first and then put it into blockchain.
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | Make sure the process is flipped

We need to enforce email uniqueness.  remove the ability to get username assignment on account creation and drop username as a means of logging in.

title: Add provider_id to data schema
body:
[User Story]  | Add provider_id to data schema on ingestion
----------|----------
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | 3
User Story | [Value Statement] "As a developer I need to know where the data came from easily"
Description | Currently on ingestion we eliminate the provider ID from the data payloads.  We need to have the provider_Id added to the data payloads to be able to sync outbound 
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | Test to ensure the provider_id has been appended to data payloads on ingestion

title: Move Add transaction process out of the provider pipelines
body:
User Story | Remove Add transaction process out of the provider pipelines
----------|----------
T-shirt size:  | S
User Story | "As a developer I want my data to be ingested as quickly as possible."

**Description**  Currently adding the transaction message is executed prior to loading into the inbound_queue.  This slows down the process and needs to happen after being sent into the inbound_queue to speed up the process and increase the speed and remove unnecessary dependancies.   To fix this the full module add_transaction needs to be moved to the ledger_sunc inbound processing pipeline.   Any references to relationship_id needs to be refactored to reflect next_id.   All references to block chain as part of docker requirements for providers should be removed.  

**Acceptance Criteria/Tests** Tests to support the movement of the transaction messaging into ledger-sync.  Docker container requirements are slimmer for the providers.  All references to relationship_id in transaction_processor should be gone or added to the remove realtionship_id ticket.

title: Stop removing Keys that have a value of 'None'
body:
[User Story] [Epic] | Stop removing keys that have a value of None
----------|----------
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | s
User Story | "As a user I want all my data recorded in case it misses updates by turning to None value."
Description | Currently if a value of an inbound payload is None or equates to a 'None' It is removed.  This is an issue as you may not get updates that are necessary because it is updated to a null value.
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | Tests and None values not being deleted.

title: Stop force filling the name field with three other options
body:
[User Story] | Stop force filling the name fields with three other options
----------|----------
User Story Title | Stop force filling the name fields with three other options
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | S
User Story | [Value Statement] "As a user I do not want my information mutated through the use of NEXT filling in the wrong information"
Description | Currently we fill in the name field with three other name fields.   Because of this it is an issue that it may mutate data when outbound is working again.  
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | Test that this is not happening.

title: Remove relationship_id field and usage
body:
User Story | Remove relationship_id field and usage
----------|----------
User Story Title | Remove relationship_id and usage
T-shirt size:  | M

**User Story**  "As a developer we need a UUID schema that will be the same through out the app.

**Description** Currently UUIds are of a mixed format across the app and there is no way to have them be linked between AD providers.   The relationship field is an exact copy of the remote_id fields and is used as the main id for forming objects on ingestion.  This needs to be removed after being replaced by a next_id.  Move through the app and remove it and make sure it is replaced correctly by next_id.  Files affected will be providers/common/inbound_filters, leger_sync/inbound/listener.  And everywhere else remote_id is references.

**Acceptance Criteria/Tests**  Tests must be associated with this along with the changes to removal of relationship_id from the filters.  The result is that relationship_id should no longer exist in the app.

title: Change User Creation process
body:
[User Story] [Epic] | Change User Creation process
----------|----------
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | M
User Story | "As a developer I want all UUIDs to have the same format"

**Description:** Currently we use UUID4 for generating new packs and new groups.  We do not do the same for new users.   We need to change that to match the other UUIDs.  This will need to create a user object in the user mapping table even if they have no external providers.  In that scenario it will have an provider_id of None and a remote_id of None and only have an next_id.  and a public key stored on the user mapping table.  The main file to be affected is server/api/users > create_new_user function.

**Acceptance Criteria/Tests:** Users created through the app will use the UUID V4 and test that are associated with this feature.  User created into the user mapping table.  Can log in and function as a user currently does in the front end.

T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | S

Description | Currently we unpack arrays or remove empty fields on ingestion.  That needs to not happen so we need to remove it from the inbound filter section.
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | Tests need to be adjusted and the data must not be transformed.

title: Landing page for first logon
body:
User Story | Initial page ("Home" screen) when logging into Next
----------|----------
T-shirt size: SML | 
User Story | As a new user of nExT, on login I want to see a fairly simple UI that has logical choices available so I can get oriented.
Description | Maybe this is irrelevant once #1014 is put in place. 
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | user is presented with simple UI and intuitively knows where to start exploring after logon.   Clicking the "Next" logo in the upper left corner of the UI should return them to this place in case I get lost in the app somehow...

Question:  Currently we remember whether user wanted to see Approver view or User view...  do they have the same home page with different left side panes?

----------|----------
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) |

title: Include a reason when rejecting a proposal
body:
[User Story] | Track a reason for rejection
----------|----------
T-shirt size: | 
User Story | As an approver in the Next System, I want to be able to communicate to people my reasons for rejecting their requests to gain access to my roles.  This will help cut down repeat requests and avoid hurt feelings.
Description | A short description 
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | (see bulleted list)
- The edit control for entering a reason for rejection should appear in the email template (for responding the proposal directly in email)
- when rejecting a single user the edit control appears in the chatbot interface (maybe?)
- when rejecting multiple users all at once, the same reason will get sent to all of them
- since we dot write rejected proposals to the ledger we should record the reason too.
- the reason *should* be visible when a user views their rejected proposals on the left hand pane.

title: Animated Tutorial
body:
User Story | Help new users get started with a short tutorial
----------|----------
T-shirt size: | 
User Story | As a brand new user of NexT, I want to be walked through how to accomplish some basic tasks in Next so I don't have to pester my co-workers for help.
Description |  Maybe just a set of slides that a user can view at startup, maybe something where we animate the UI itself...  maybe with a pen that draws over the UI and highlights what to do.
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | Tutorial offered to new users on first login - flag set on acct so we know we have shown it?  Or user explicitly says "don't show me this again"??.  Re-run tutorial option somewhere in the options in case user wants to see it again.  SysAdmin able to turn off tutorial all together via app setting.  Tutorial should highlight -- request a role, roles come in packs, approver mode, user config settings, chatbot?

title: [User Story] Password strength & reuse policy
body:
User Story | Employ pw strength & reuse policy rules
----------|----------
Epic Title | #65 
T-shirt size:  | Large -- trending toward obese maybe...
User Story | "As a user of a NexT, my passwords should be as secure as any other in the org.  This app should inherit the pw reuse rules set by the greater org and enforce them."
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | The user should be prevented from creating a pw that doesn't meet the org rules.  The user shouldn't be allowed to reuse a previous password in alignment with org rules.
Questions | How can we sync to the org rules for pw management?  Is it in AD somewhere?  Is it sufficient to duplicate the org rules in our app and require someone to manually sync with corp?  Disallowing reuse means we need to store the previous PW somewhere (secure?)  If we are utilizing corp AD for auth, can we simply force users to change PW from another app and we don't need to mess with any of this?

title: [User Story] Password challenge questions
body:
[User Story] | challenge questions / MFA
----------|----------
Epic Title | #65
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) |  Large -- maybe extra large
User Story | [Value Statement] "For enhanced security around PW for NeXt, we should verify user identity when attempting to reset/modify -- either MFA or challenge questions"
Description |  
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | The list of tests or criteria to be used to validate the story has been completed. May still need UAT or SIT / integration testing with other stories.
Questions | if we use MFA, are we going to send a challenge every time user logs in?  Perhaps when they log in from an unrecognized device?  Expire every <configurable XX> months?  This is going to complicate registration process -- add secret questions or enroll in MFA at signup.

title: [User Story] AD (LDAP) authentication incorporated into NEXT
body:
[User Story] | AD authentication incorporated into NEXT
----------|----------
Epic Title | #271
User Story Title | AD authentication incorporated into NEXT
T-shirt size: S(mall), M(edium), L(arge) | M
Story Point | 2
User Story | Users will be able to provide their AD credentials when logging into the NEXT platform. Once logged in, the user will see the data associated to their AD account (name, groups, org hierarchy, etc.).
Description | A short description 
Acceptance Criteria/Tests | 1) any user with a current acct in AD (that is being synced with NEXT) should be able to log into Next using their AD credentials. 2) On NEXT, the account will have access to view and perform RBAC operations (requesting group access, delegating to others, etc.) for their AD account.  3) NEXT should be able to output meaningful error messages regarding to a user's login attempt.

title: BLOCKED [Task] Create Development Branch
body:
Task | Create Development Branch
----------|----------
Task Title | Create Development Branch
Description | Find out if a development branch can be created and merged with Master. If possible, create a 'Dev' branch to be used as a sandbox, all incoming PRs will be merged into Dev, and once verified as stable, Dev will be merged into Master. All subsequent stg/prod builds will use Master, and any dev builds will use the new Dev branch.
Business Need (the why): | Developers need an unstable dev environment that is separate from the stg environment. Stg/prod should be stable for demos. 
Applications or Systems impacted | The repo and internal stg environment.
