title: Role owners do not have permissions to add/delete members and admins
body:
When a role owner attempts to add or delete members and admins to/from their role, the following error message is outputted:
```
{
    "code": 400,
    "message": "Bad Request: Txn signer 03fdda9a0d513e870d45c0cc1acfd2fb3df234bc284b4d34397f8bba29c6c8d410 is not the user or the user's manager ['022b5e227f51fd5713d629fe75206d60a562aaea3c8fb59a52f8cfc2e494f6850a', '']"
}
```

It appears role owners can only add or delete members or admins only if the role owner is the manager of the targeted user or they are the user themselves. Role owners should have full control of their role and they should have the ability to add/delete any user even if the owner is not the manager of the targeted user or the user being added/deleted. 

### Scenario
The owner of role `c5e52d53-68e7-437e-b9b6-27afec9a1f29` would like to delete the role member with the user id `022b5e227f51fd5713d629fe75206d60a562aaea3c8fb59a52f8cfc2e494f6850a`

Here is the CURL request for this operation:
`$ curl -X DELETE "http://localhost:8000/api/roles/c5e52d53-68e7-437e-b9b6-27afec9a1f29/members" -H "accept: application/json" -H "Authorization: role_owner's_bearer_token" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d "{ \"id\": \"022b5e227f51fd5713d629fe75206d60a562aaea3c8fb59a52f8cfc2e494f6850a\"}"
`

### Expected Result
A proposal would have been created with the type REMOVE_ROLE_MEMBERS and the response would have contained the proposal ID.
```
{
  "proposal_id": "63467642-6067-4c82-a096-1a1972d776b3"
}
```

### Actual Result
```
{
    "code": 400,
    "message": "Bad Request: Txn signer 03fdda9a0d513e870d45c0cc1acfd2fb3df234bc284b4d34397f8bba29c6c8d410 is not the user or the user's manager ['022b5e227f51fd5713d629fe75206d60a562aaea3c8fb59a52f8cfc2e494f6850a', '']"
}
```

title: Access request reasoning is not being saved
body:
When requesting access to a group, the user is asked to input their reason for their access request. After looking over the proposal object that is created for this request, the reasoning does not appear to have been saved.

### Scenario
User with id `022b5e227f51fd5713d629fe75206d60a562aaea3c8fb59a52f8cfc2e494f6850a `is requesting access to group/role `c5e52d53-68e7-437e-b9b6-27afec9a1f29`. User inputted the following reasoning: "I need access to this group for business purposes". I have provided the expected and actual results of the proposal object that is created.

### Expected Results
```
"data": [
        {
            "target": "022b5e227f51fd5713d629fe75206d60a562aaea3c8fb59a52f8cfc2e494f6850a",
            "id": "b2e6a24a-ba2c-4815-906f-db99e4f46bbf",

            "closer": "",
            "opener": "022b5e227f51fd5713d629fe75206d60a562aaea3c8fb59a52f8cfc2e494f6850a",
            "approvers": [
                "03fdda9a0d513e870d45c0cc1acfd2fb3df234bc284b4d34397f8bba29c6c8d410"
            ]
        }
    ]
```

title: Add Apache 2.0 LICENSE file
body: Signed-off-by: Ry Jones <ry@linux.com>

title: Allow docker image build without config.py
body: The config.py is configuration, and should not prevent the build of the server image.  It is still required for running the server image obviously, and the example is there to build off of.

title: Add ISOLATION_ID to docker-compose files
body: To prevent build clashes and consistency with the rest of sawtooth among other reasons.

title: fix bug that prevents logging in with newly created users
body: added Name for user table and username for auth table to be able to identify the login user

title: Question on documentation: getting started with the developer environment
body:
Hello,

I apologize in advance if the questions below seem stupid--I'm new to sawtooth in general and the NEXT project looked interesting.

I'm having issues setting up my machine to test this project. I followed the instructions on setting up the developer environment:

- I renamed `config.example.py` to `config.py`. Although this wasn't specifically specified under the developer section in the `README`, I figured I had to do this. I didn't change the default values since it's just for development purposes. 
- I ran the following commands:
```
bin/build -p
docker-compose -f docker-compose-dev.yaml up
```

I could successfully connect to `localhost:9090` and had access to the Rethink.DB admin page. However, my browser failed to establish a connection to the REST API on  `localhost:8080`.

Additionally, I had two errors in the console upon starting up:

1. Couldn't establish a database connection to ReThink.DB:
```
ledger-sync_1  | rethinkdb.errors.ReqlDriverError: Could not connect to rethink:28015. Error: [Errno 111] Connection refused
```
2. I also had the following error:
```
validator_1    | [2018-06-13 23:09:01.978 ERROR    cli] Cannot have a genesis_batch_file and an existing chain
```
Additionally, I tried following the instructions to setup the UI for a developer environment, but I couldn't get it working either. 

1. I changed directory to the `ui` folder--for me, it was located at `~/NEXT/sawtooth-next-directory/ui `
2. I ran `npm install`
3. Then I ran `npm install -g angular-cli` to install angular client.
4. Finally, I ran `npm install -g rxjs@5.0.1` because NPM said I was missing that dependency when I ran `npm list -g --depth=0`.

After finishing the steps above, when I tried to run `ng serve` from within the UI folder, I got a message saying `You have to be inside an angular-cli project in order to use the serve command.`

Lastly, assuming I fix all of the errors above, is there a way to simulate nodes (or is it provided already in the development environment included in the package?) in order to simulate having real people using the system? I'm just trying to get a feeling for how it would function on a production environment.

Thanks! I'm running Ubuntu 16.04 LTS.

title: Fix incorrect hostname for rbac-server in compose YAML
body: Changes the hostname the UI connects to in the compose file to `localhost` and sets the `--host` to `0.0.0.0` at server startup.

title: Add 'All Users' page
body:
* Adds an 'All Users' page that lists each user's name and ID
* Adds a 'Create User' button to create a new user without logging into that user
* Clicking on a user shows all of the groups of which they are a member

title: Fix additional API integration tests
body: After this update, all API integration tests pass except for `DELETE (200) /api/roles/{id}/tasks` which requires a more complicated setup than is currently provided in `insert_sample_data.py`.

title: Update to use Sawtooth 1.0 SDK
body:
- Fix docker files to use latest images and commands
- Updates processor to use latest messages
- Change ledger sync to use new client state events
